bug.short_desc: Better access to the list tempaltes

long_desc.thetext: The list in the next branch is based on two templates, one for the list items and one for the group header. These templates contain how and what to render from the given model data. So as the data may differ from app to app, the template might as well. At the moment, the only chance to change that is to override the static key the templates hold. It would be good to have a way to easily configure the template used by the list on widget base.

Converting the static members into properties would be easy enough, plus we could use the apply mechanism to trigger re-rendering on template changes. Or do you think we need some kind of general template handling infrastructure?

(In reply to comment #1) > Converting the static members into properties would be easy enough, plus we > could use the apply mechanism to trigger re-rendering on template changes. Or > do you think we need some kind of general template handling infrastructure?
Maybe there is more necessary to get the templates properly supported. But using properties might be enough. That should be our first check starting this issue.
